Detailed Description

A validator for double values.

This class provides a validator that ensures a string contains a valid double within a specified range.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum TValueValidator::EValidateResult [inherited]

Enumerator:
VR_BAD  means that validation has failed.
VR_OK  means that validation has passed.
VR_FIXED  means that validated value has corrected automatically during validation.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TDoubleValidator::TDoubleValidator ( double  minimum = -HUGE_VAL,
double  maximum = HUGE_VAL,
int  decimals = 5,
QObject *  parent = 0 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
minimum is the minimum allowed value, -HUGE_VAL by default.
maximum is the maximum allowed value, HUGE_VAL by default.
decimals is the max number of decimals, 5 by default.

Member Function Documentation

virtual EValidateResult TDoubleValidator::checkValue ( QVariant &  value  )  [virtual]

Validates a "value" normally passed from item editor. If the value is lower than "minimum", it will be fixed to "minimum". If the value is greater than "maximum", it will be fixed to "maximum". If the value is not a double, the validation will fail.

See also:
minimum(), maximum()

Implements TValueValidator.
